description: Students explore geographic, economic, political, and ethnic dimensions of life in Costa Rica by
combining intensive course work with such cross-cultural experiences as a homestay in San
Jose, field work, visits to sites of cultural interest, and excursions to the Atlantic and Pacific
coasts.  They consolidate their language skills and continue to develop their skills for analyzing
and communicating in Spanish through compositions, oral presentations, and interviews of
Costa Ricans.  Prerequisite: SPAN 231 or placement. Not open to students who have
fullname: Intermediate Spanish II in Costa Rica (abroad)
